revisionDesc.change: transcribed, English 213, Dr. Mike Chasar, Willamette University
transcribed, English 213, Dr. Mike Chasar, Willamette University

div1.p: May I beg your acceptance of the following lines as a sort of valentine from one who in reading your beautiful 'Leaves' learned to love the author.

They are meant to convey the idea derived by
me as to the scope and aim of the teaching of your poems. As such they are necessarily very incomplete and ineffective and it is perhaps trespassing on your good nature to trouble you with them. I feel, however, unable to withhold my tribute–feeble as it is and I can only pray you to forgive my presumption.

lg.l:
All things in the universe form one
in indissoluble whole,

And each infinitesimal part is énorme
and complete in itself,

And in every human being is the essence
and potence of all.

Whence: Tolerance wide as the spheres
and Love of unlimited scope,

And Brotherhood all the world o'er
and sympathy seasoned with Hope.
